net.cabezudo.json.annotations

Annotation Type JSONProperty


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface JSONProperty
    Marks an object attribute like a property of a JSON object. You can also indicate with the annotation the name you want for the field in the JSON object using the element name. Also you can indicate if you want to show the property in the result JSON object if the property value is zero or if the property is null. If the field will be a referenceable field you can specify the field that be used like reference with the element field. Also you can specify if the field can be referenced or not using the element referenced.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Fields and Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_NAME
      A string indicating if the name of the field will be the same for the JSON object property.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_REFERENCED_PROPERTY
      The default property name for referenced fields.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean dontShowIfNull
      Indicate if the property should be included in the JSON object if it is null or not.
      boolean dontShowIfZero
      Indicate if the property should be included in the JSON object if is zero or not.
      java.lang.String field
      Return the referenced field name used for an object in the annotated field.
      java.lang.String name
      The name of the JSON object.
      boolean referenced
      Return if the field can be referenced or not.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_NAME
        A string indicating if the name of the field will be the same for the JSON object property.

      • DEFAULT_REFERENCED_PROPERTY

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_REFERENCED_PROPERTY
        The default property name for referenced fields.

    • Element Detail

      • name

        public abstract java.lang.String name
        The name of the JSON object.
        Returns:
        a string indicating that the name of the JSON object property. If the method return DEFAULT_NAME the library must use the field name.
        Default:
        "The same as the name of the property."

      • dontShowIfZero

        public abstract boolean dontShowIfZero
        Indicate if the property should be included in the JSON object if is zero or not.
        Returns:
        true if the property with null value will not show in the JSON object, false otherwise.
        Default:
        false

      • dontShowIfNull

        public abstract boolean dontShowIfNull
        Indicate if the property should be included in the JSON object if it is null or not.
        Returns:
        true if the property with null value will not show in the JSON object, false otherwise.
        Default:
        false

      • field

        public abstract java.lang.String field
        Return the referenced field name used for an object in the annotated field. The default value is id.
        Returns:
        the name of the field used like reference.
        Default:
        "id"

      • referenced

        public abstract boolean referenced
        Return if the field can be referenced or not. The default value is {code true}.
        Returns:
        true if the field is referenced {code false} otherwise.
        Default:
        true
